edu.kit.informatik.matchthree.framework.interfaces

Interface Board


  • public interface Board
    A rectangular square-tiled game board.

    The board has a fixed number of rows and columns of fields which are arranged in the shape of a matrix. It contains at least 2 columns and 2 rows. The fields are identified by their row and column indices. The indices are counted from the top left field starting with 0. A 3 by 3 field has the following shape:

    (0,0) (1,0) (2,0)
    (0,1) (1,1) (2,1)
    (0,2) (1,2) (2,2)
    Each field can be empty or filled with one Token.
    Author:
    IPD Koziolek

    • Method Detail

      • getAllValidTokens

        java.util.Set<Token> getAllValidTokens()
        Returns all Tokens that can be placed on the board.

        The result always contains at least two different Tokens. The result must always the same for one instance of a Board.

        Returns:
        all Tokens that can be placed on the board.

      • getColumnCount

        int getColumnCount()
        Returns the number of columns on the board.

        Is always larger than or equal to 2. The result must always the same for one instance of a Board.

        Returns:
        the number of columns on the board.

      • getRowCount

        int getRowCount()
        Returns the number of rows on the board.

        Is always larger than or equal to 2. The result must always the same for one instance of a Board.

        Returns:
        the number of rows on the board.

      • getTokenAt

        Token getTokenAt(Position position)
        Returns the Token at the given position.
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the requested Token. The position must not be null and must be contained in the board, i.e. containsPosition(Position) must be true for the given position.
        Returns:
        the Token at the given Position or null, if the position is empty.
        Throws:
        BoardDimensionException - when the position is not on the board.

      • setTokenAt

        void setTokenAt(Position position,
                Token newToken)
        Sets or removes the Token at the given position.

        If the given token is null, the field is empty after the call of this method.

        Parameters:
        position - the Position on the board to manipulate
        newToken - the Token that should be placed on the field or null
        Throws:
        BoardDimensionException - if position is not contained in the board
        IllegalTokenException - if the token is not valid for this board

      • containsPosition

        boolean containsPosition(Position position)
        Indicates whether the given position is contained in the board.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to check.
        Returns:
        true iff position is contained in this board

      • moveTokensToBottom

        java.util.Set<Position> moveTokensToBottom()
        Moves all tokens on the board to the maximum row position that can be reached without skipping other tokens.

        After this operation has finished there are only empty fields at the top of the board, if there are any. Subsequent calls to this method have no effect and always return an empty set.

        Returns:
        the set of positions on the resulting board that have been modified by this operation. Never null. Might be an empty set.

      • swapTokens

        void swapTokens(Position positionA,
                Position positionB)
        Swaps the tokens at the given positions.

        If there is no token on one of the given positions, the token is moved from the non-empty to the empty position. If both positions on the field are empty, nothing happens.

        Calling swapTokens(a, b) always has the same effect as swapTokens(b, a).

        Parameters:
        positionA - the first position to swap
        positionB - the second position to swap
        Throws:
        BoardDimensionException - if either of the positions is not contained in the board

      • removeTokensAt

        void removeTokensAt(java.util.Set<Position> positions)
        Removes all tokens at the given positions.

        If one of the positions is already empty, nothing happens to this field and the other fields are handled normally. If one of the positions is not contained in the board, a BoardDimensionException is thrown and nothing happens (i.e. the state of the board is not changed by this method).

        Parameters:
        positions - The set of positions for which tokens should be removed. Must not contain null or a position that is not on the board.
        Throws:
        BoardDimensionException - if one of the positions is not contained in the board.

      • setFillingStrategy

        void setFillingStrategy(FillingStrategy strategy)
        Sets a filling strategy for the board.
        Parameters:
        strategy - the new filling strategy. Must not be null.

      • fillWithTokens

        void fillWithTokens()
        Fills the board with tokens using a previously set FillingStrategy.
        Throws:
        NoFillingStrategyException - if no FillingStrategy has been set using setFillingStrategy(FillingStrategy) prior.

      • toTokenString

        java.lang.String toTokenString()
        Returns a token string representation of the board.

        A token string consists of a concatenation of the String representations of the tokens in each row. Empty fields are denoted by a space (" "). The rows are separated by semicolon (;). There is no trailing semicolon.

        Returns:
        a token string representation of the board.
